content.question: The figure above shows a rectangle inscribed in a semicircle with a radius of 2. The area of such a rectangle is given by <math alttext="A, of x, equals, 2 x, times the square root of 4 minus x squared, end root" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><msqrt><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, where the width of the rectangle is <math alttext="2 x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. It can be shown that <math alttext="A, prime of x, equals, the fraction with numerator negative 2 times x squared, and denominator the square root of 4 minus x squared, end root, end fraction, plus 2 times the square root of 4 minus x squared, end root" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has critical values of <math alttext="negative 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="the negative of the square root of 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="the square root of 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>, and 2. It can also be shown that <math alttext="A prime of x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> changes from positive to negative at <math alttext="x equals, the square root of 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: The inscribed rectangle with maximum area has dimensions <math alttext="the square root of 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math> by <math alttext="the square root of 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The inscribed rectangle with minimum area has dimensions <math alttext="the square root of 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math> by <math alttext="the square root of 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The inscribed rectangle with maximum area has dimensions <math alttext="2 times the square root of 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> by <math alttext="the square root of 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The inscribed rectangle with minimum area has dimensions <math alttext="2 times the square root of 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> by <math alttext="the square root of 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The inscribed rectangle with maximum area has dimensions <math alttext="2 times the square root of 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> by <math alttext="the square root of 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mstyle></math>.
